alert.note: Alert for Haskell; McIntosh; Muskogee; Okmulgee; Pittsburg (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 04 at 10:15PM CDT until May 04 at 11:15PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tulsa has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... West central Haskell County in southeastern Oklahoma... McIntosh County in southeastern Oklahoma... Northeastern Pittsburg County in southeastern Oklahoma... Southeastern Okmulgee County in northeastern Oklahoma... Central Muskogee County in east central Oklahoma... * Until 1115 PM CDT. * At 1015 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 4 miles south of Henryetta, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations in or near the path include... Okmulgee... Eufaula... Henryetta... Checotah... Morris... Dewar... Schulter... Oktaha... Grayson... Council Hill... Rentiesville... Hoffman... Stidham... Raiford... Vivian... Lake Eufaula State Park... Enterprise... Keefeton... Wainwright... Summit... This includes Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 239 and 274. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for southeastern, northeastern and east central Oklahoma. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
